title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 29.2 - Records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 29.2 - Records

State Regulations

The operator of each such bulk tank hauling facility or
route shall keep a detailed record of the quantity of milk received from each
source and the quantity delivered to each destination. Such records shall be
kept at a designated location for a period of at least three years, and shall
be made available for examination or audit by any duly authorized
representative of the commissioner. Such records shall include the full name
and address of each producer from whom milk was received, his cooperative
affiliation, if any, and such other records as the commissioner may deem
necessary. The disposal of all samples to be tested for butterfat content shall
also be thus recorded. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
29.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
